meanings.definition: The act of making a loud, roaring sound like that of a motor vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The vrooming of the motorcycle echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent2: I heard the vrooming of a car as it sped down the street.
meanings.sent3: The vrooming of the lawnmower startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: The vrooming of the jet taking off was deafening.
meanings.sent5: The vrooming of the race cars filled the air with excitement.

meanings.definition: To accelerate or move quickly with a loud noise.
meanings.sent1: The car was vrooming down the highway, leaving a trail of dust behind.
meanings.sent2: She vroomed past me on her skateboard, laughing all the way.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel vroomed up the tree to escape the chasing dog.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to vroom by as we enjoyed our day at the park.
meanings.sent5: The rocket vroomed into the sky, leaving a fiery trail behind.
